pages.title: Legacy Applications/Code
text: Often a lot of hard work, and investment has gone into building legacy applications. Often we have also put in a lot of thought into them.
What do we mean by legacy applications? This is code has become a little dated and not quite as shiny as it once was.

Typically the core logic is still solid, but over time the UI (look and feel) tends to have become a bit lacklustre. The other thing that can happen is that the technology it runs on may now not be current.
It is also possible the datamodel needs updating
What makes it legacy is when it reaches that point where people are too afraid to update the application anymore because it still 'works'.
• Architect a plan for modernising and revitalising them
Our principles are to keep your proprietary information in strictest confidence and will gladly sign any NDAs.

pages.title: New Product Design
text: If you are an entrepreneurs with a new software idea, you may benefit greatly from a kind ear to bounce ideas off. We offer a Skype call service where you can ring us and discuss some ideas.
• Become a Non-executive director on your board

Disclaimer: Scared of us stealing your ideas? Our reputation is important to us. We will sign a NDA, and keep the ideas in the strictest confidence. Also if there is any conflict of interest we will let you know and not take the project on.

pages.title: Analyse Current Code
text: Developers working hard, but not sure about quality or maintainability?
We will review the code base, and produce a set of diagrams and keep them up to date.
• A diagram of what is accomplished vs todo
• A set of Diagrams of the code structure
• A plan of what is still to be built

The power of Diagrams is meaning condensed to simple pictures. Visual language is a great way for new people to come on board and quickly get to grips with the project. They are also incredible at reporting progress.
Architectural drawings can also be a specification that developers can take away and build
